result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua A Papageorge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation.  If revokded, out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua A Papageorge in court with attorney James D. Rael.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 30 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 18 months with credit for 2 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 12 months.

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years.

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, FORTHWITH.  Huber privileges for work and treatment.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation.  If revokded, out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Appeal rights given.  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Upon successful completion of the sentence, defendant may apply for expungement. 

- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Joshua A Papageorge in court with attorney James D. Rael.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is in trial.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.   Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Telephone call from attorney Procaccio to reschedule sentencing hearing calendared on September 2, 2015 at 8:30 am.  Defendant has a work commitment.  Defense counsel has already consulted with ADA St. Junior.   Case scheduled for projected guilty plea on September 9, 2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 26.

Defendant Joshua A Papageorge in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated August 7, 2015 received and filed.

Defense counsel needs additional discovery and requests new date.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel requesting additional time. Case adjourned for scheduling conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joshua A Papageorge in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Ron Dague for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/20/15.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26.

Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.
